revised_title: The Earth's Inner Core Composition: Nickel Silicide Instead of Nickel-Iron
tldr: The author suggests that the Earth's inner core is composed of nickel silicide rather than nickel-iron metal, based on the analysis of meteorites and their elemental composition. This discovery would imply that the Earth's interior was formed from primordial matter that was oxygen-poor, allowing silicon to be present in the iron liquid.
